@the-legend89: Now Im no expert when it comes to this stuff either, but the download speed of your torrents is still dependent on the amount of seeders and leachers. And also dependent on your connection speed. I think I can say with certainty that you will not reach the maximum speed of your new router. I know of no one who can dowload torrents with such a speed. Connect to your router and enable UPNP. Also enable it in your Bittorrent client. a Port will now automatically be forwarded. I hope this helps you out a bit. Like I said Im no expert at this stuff, just know a thing or 2. Used portforward.com myself to configure my router and my connection is said up correctly now. if you are not familiar with that site, check it to see if if you can configure your router. They have guides on portforwarding for most brands of routers on that site ;)

Thanks for the upload. However are there any english subtitles for this BDRIP please??  Any1 out there care to prove their piracy genoristy please?

By the way, for thsoe who dont know what BDRips is, BDRip means Blue Ray Disk Rip and are much much better than DVDRIPS. BDRips are encoded directly from the BluRay disk, so should be  of better quality than a DVDRip. They usually have a resolution of 720p (or 1080p), and are encoded using the matroska (.mkv) container and x264 codec. Bluray Rips are far superior to DVD rips. A DVD rip is often around 640Ă272 pixels which equals .174 Megapixels per frame. A Bluray rip is often relased at 1280X720 pixels, which equals .921 Megapixels per frame. ANY LCD will resolve more than the 272 vertical pixels a typical DVD rip contains!! Adios DVDRips
